description: The Tupolev Tu-4 is a strategic conventional bomber. It is a reverse-engineered version of the Boeing B-29A. The NATO reporting name is Bull.
natoreportingnames: NATO reporting name for aircraft is Bull.
variantnotes: Gun Turrets. Equipped with ten 23 mm NS-23 cannons in turrets and in the tail. They can fire in any direction. They may return fire twice per game turn in response to a gun attacks or conduct a single attack. The roll to hit is 2/1/1 and the AtA rating is 4. Gun attacks are modified only by the target size and have a -1 modifier when firing into the 60- arc. Ammunition is 11.
loadnotes: Stations 1 and 2 are the forward and rear internal bays. Each can carry up to (a) two 1,500 kg (3,300 lb) FAB-1500 M46 bombs,  (b) six 500 kg (1,100 lb) FAB-500 M46 bombs, (c) twelve 250 kg (550 lb) FAB-250 M46 bombs, or (d) two fuel tanks (each 2400L, weight 4,000, and 200 fuel points). All bombs must be the same type.

As an exception to the normal rules for load points, internal loads contribute 1 load point for each 1,000 of weight and internal fuel contributes 1 load point for each 50 fuel points. A return mission will typically require leaving the target with at least 750 fuel points (15 load points).
